July 1, 2020

Millersburg Area School District Families,

As promised, the Millersburg Area School District is sending this communication today to advise you of our decision regarding the status of this year’s Prom.

In working with our students, parents, vendors, and the leadership at the Ned Smith Center for Nature and Art, we are pleased to announce that our 2020 Prom WILL occur on July 17, 2020, contingent upon Dauphin County remaining in the Green Phase.

Parents choosing to allow their child to participate will be required to sign a Prom Participation Acknowledgement Form indicating they understand the potential increased risk of exposure to COVID-19 as a result of attending this event.

While we are excited to see our students participate in Prom this year, the Prom Walk and Post Prom events will not be held.

Additional details and participation forms will be forthcoming from Mr. Shover, High School Principal.

With continuing appreciation of your support and understanding,

Thomas J. Haupt
Superintendent

A Kinder Lesson in Economics

Today representatives from Mid Penn Bank came to kindergarten to teach them some basic lessons about economics. Kinders learned about wants verses needs as well as some other important lessons about using money wisely. Students were read the book "Three Cups" and talked about the importance of giving, saving, and spending money. The book is written from the perspective of a five year old so it is perfect for our kinders and their families. The book provides an opportunity for great family conversations about what is important and valued in your household when it comes to finances. You can find some cups (label them give, save, and spend) and start your own adventure. A big thanks to Mid Penn Bank for teaching our youngest children valuable lessons.

Troop H, Lykens

The members of the Pennsylvania State Police, Troop H, Lykens Station, would like to remind motorists to be cognizant of the return to school by students and staff. In the interest of safety, we will be enhancing our monitoring and enforcement of speed limits around schools. Students, staff, and parents should also be aware that an increased presence of uniformed members, in both marked and unmarked patrol vehicles, will be seen in school areas and within parking lots throughout the school year.

Additionally, surveillance of school buses and subsequent enforcement actions will be taken against motorists failing to stop and obey school bus flashing lights and controls. Routinely students will be gathering around bus stops, crossing roadways, and at times possibly rushing to get to their bus arrival point or departing from their bus toward their homes after school. Motorists share a tremendous responsibility to be aware, be safe, and be ready to stop!

We all must do our part to keep our students safe.

This week our 6th Grade science students participated in a “Seismic Safe Structure Testing” STEAM activity. All 6th grade students built a “house” and then tested it on the shake cart to see if it would stay intact. A raw egg (in a baggie) was placed in each house to see if the egg would survive. The activity is a culmination of their earthquake unit.

What another fantastic example of practical, hands-on learning taking place in our classrooms as part of our STEAM initiative! Great work, 6th Grade! #mlbgsdtribepride

“Blood Drive 2019” was held on Tuesday, April 9th at the Millersburg Area High School. The school registered 37 individuals to donate and we were able to collect 29 pints of blood. A special thank you goes to our school nurse, Mrs. Stephanie Spotts, and the following students: Hannah Carns, Montana Behrendt, Crista Martin, and Layla Engle. These high school students helped with the Blood Drive assembly in January and encouraged students and faculty to sign up and donate. They also aided during the blood drive by helping the donors fill out paperwork and providing them with educational materials regarding donation.

Thank you for helping us to supply our community with this precious, life-saving resource! #mlbgsdtribepride
